job_title: Federal Work Study Student in Geneseo, NY
pros: Specifically at MacVittie union, it's nice to be able to work on my homework and be paid for it. In addition the job is really easy.
cons: The annoying thing is the current student residence life director has been performing incredibly poorly the last few years. First year he was great, now he isn't. This is reflected in his choice to union managers. Recently his employment decision have been laughably bad, whereas 3 years ago he hired actual good managers.

pros: There are no pros I can think of
cons: Administration does everything wrong at this school.

pros: A little more job security during turbulent times. The campus is general works diligently to be student and trend setting focused.
cons: It is difficult to climb the ladder due to state service criteria and being in a rural setting.

pros: Solid employer with collaborative staff members
cons: Can't think of any at this time.

review_title: Working with student life has its ups and downs.
pros: I learned a lot about professionalism, leadership, and responsibility in the student life department. I had the opportunity to understand resident life better as well as to become more comfortable with managing tasks and navigating conflicts.
cons: Some of my growth was due to my employer, and some of it was due to having to figure things out on our own. It could be difficult to figure out exactly how student life wanted us to do things, but doing things wrong can be serious. The "3 strikes you're out" system for firing was particularly stressful because the 3 strikes can cover all types of things, such as an issue with paperwork being equally serious as a true transgression such as lying. There was a lot of pressure in this position and the workload was sometimes unrealistic for the number of staff vs students.

pros: The students here are fantastic, they are some of the hardest working, most driven, and generally affable students I've encountered anywhere.  Working in student affairs with them is easy.
cons: The upper levels of management, particularly in student life, seem more concerned with appearances than reality.  There is a definitive inferiority complex here - this school wants to be Harvard, and attempts to put forth that kind of image.  As a result, things that look good, but don't actually work, are often promoted at the expense of students.

review_title: A decent, convenient place to work for students with many different kinds of shifts available.
job_title: Grill Server, Line Server, Dishroom in Geneseo, NY
pros: Short shifts, flexibility, many opportunities to work additional shifts/hours, usually good relations with fellow student employees and non-student employees. As a student you are virtually guaranteed a position as long as you sign up very early in the semester.
cons: Food service is generally not thrilling or very rewarding. Depending on your shift you may not have everything you need to do your job properly, sometimes you are trained well for a shift, sometimes you aren't and have to figure it out as you go. Little emphasis on rules/regulations, which is a littler disturbing since we are preparing/serving food.

pros: The amount of training and support you get are excellent. The selection process is tough, so there is a feeling of accomplishment in just even getting a position. Once, your in though you realise that the job is constantly challenging you to grow as a person.
cons: Some residence directors are incompetent. People are constantly moving positions and leaving the college. Its hard to make lasting connections with superiors. You are always on your toes to make a good impression. You definately can not rest on the image you create for yourself.

review_title: Fun place to work as long as you don’t demand too much.
pros: Fun place where everyone feels welcome! SUNY is a place that promotes diversity. The faculty and administration are both supportive and flexible. The quaint little town is a wonderful community with lots of shops and restaurants. Close to Rochester!
cons: Organization; Just during my employment process documents got lost twice. Everything takes longer than one would expect. The students cannot be pushed too much almost as if the faculty is there to make sure that students enjoy themselves (firstly) and than perhaps learn something.

review_title: Great opportunity and resume builder for college students.
pros: Limited hours so still able to focus on studies, great group of people, learn valuable lessons in teaching, time management, and patience.
cons: It is a lot to learn quickly for the first time. I taught a class of 25+ students with no experience or co-TA so it had to be a quick transition, nonetheless it was easy to pick up if the time and dedication were put in before class.

review_title: Solid educational institution with a chance to work with great young minds.
pros: Fair pay for position, good camaraderie with department members (though this may vary by department). Beautiful area to live and work, flexible hours. New academic buildings with great computer equipment.
cons: Limited advancement opportunities, standard academic/tenure issues can arise and cause tension. limited expansion potential, isolated work environmentl

job_title: Assistant Systems Administrative in Geneseo, NY
pros: Gained a lot of relevant experience from working in the finance department as a business major. Flexible hours and emphasis placed on my school schedule was helpful.
cons: Limited hours allowed and couldn't be employed for two SUNY positions at once as a student.

review_title: Wonderful people, beautiful and serene environment
pros: Caring, genuine coworkers -- and an environment where most employees are well treated and satisfied with their jobs.
cons: The winters are cold in Western NY, if you're not used to it!

pros: The scheduling was very flexible; you're able to fit your hours around your work schedule. Both the full and part time workers are very friendly and helpful. Very convenient location.
cons: The same cons as any food service job; customers' reactions will really affect your experience.

job_title: Transfer Student Mentor in Geneseo, NY
pros: Benefits are great, people and connections you make last past college
cons: not a well defined role for a TSM

review_title: Remarkably diverse and friendly campus environment
job_title: Undergraduate Student Assistant in Geneseo, NY
pros: You interact with students, faculty and staff from different social, economic and cultural backgrounds. It's a refreshing location with lots of talent and opportunities.
cons: It's a small campus so for those people that enjoy larger campuses its not ideal.

pros: Family-like community, exciting projects, accountable team players
cons: There are no cons. Geneseo is a great work environment for students. However, there needs to be more people of color in visible roles.

pros: Schedule flexibility. Good experience to have. Some room for career growth.
cons: Very little consequences for poor work - if you work hard, you'll be picking up slack for irresponsible peers.
